text: Pages from the Owari meisho Zue is an illustrated guide describing famous places, called meisho, and depicting their scenery in pre-1868 Owari province in central Japan. It was printed using Japanese woodblock printing techniques in books divided among volumes. The Owari meisho Zue followed the publication of the Edo meisho zue, which sparked a public interest in travel guides. == External links == Category:Edo-period works Category:History of Nagoya Category:Japanese books Category:Owari Province Category:Travel guide books Category:Ukiyo-e Category:Japanese non-fiction books
title: Owari meisho zue
